messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 3210
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 4/1/2003 5:36:53 PM US Mountain Standard Time, ... You can substitute honey for sugar in many recipes. Use honey instead of sugar in tea. My
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 4/1/2003 5:36:53 PM US Mountain Standard Time,
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:

> We don't use much honey, but
> I'll probably try to start buying locally just in case. :-)
>

You can substitute honey for sugar in many recipes. Use honey instead of
sugar in tea. My kids and I love to eat peanut butter and honey sandwiches
(lot's of energy ). Honey and lemon mixed together are good for a sore
throat. There is lot's you can do with honey. Maybe others can give you ideas
as to what you can use honey in.
Vanessa
<A HREF="http://www.ubah.com/ecommerce/default.asp?sid=K1634&gid=1290955">A Fun Learning Experience With Usborne Books</A>
